caption:
This photograph shows a landscape that appears to involve both a natural setting and an area impacted by industrial activity. The foreground is dominated by a large pile of wood chips or some form of debris, suggesting the remnants of logging or a similar activity. This pile extends towards the middle of the image, forming a rough, textured hill with visible bits of wood and other fragments.

Beyond this mound in the middle of the image, there is a shallow body of water that reflects the sky and some trees. This pond or wetland area is surrounded by patches of grass and lush green vegetation, indicating a wet, marshy environment.

The background features a dense forest with a variety of trees that adds to the richness of the green color seen throughout the more natural parts of this scene. The skies above are partly cloudy, allowing for a mix of sunlight and shadow over the landscape, enhancing the natural colors and the somewhat somber mood conveyed by the contrast between the disturbed foreground and the pristine background.

Overall, the photograph captures the juxtaposition between human industrial activity and natural wilderness, highlighting the environmental impact of such activities through its visual composition.
title: Waste bark from the Georgia pacific paper co.  Piled on the bank of a polluted tributary of the st.  Croix river.  The property belongs to charles towne, one of the plaintiffs in a suit against the company
